image.altText: A for-lease sign on the left in an image showing the footpath of  regional shopping street.

props.synopsis: Businesses along regional shopping strips need to "stick to their brand" and promote "the uniqueness" of their locations to attract customers during tough times. advocate says.

title.children: Main streets are the economic centre of regional towns, but rising costs are starting to bite business

image.altText: A man holding a jumper over his head covering his whole face walking through glass doors

props.synopsis: Shane Anthony Matherson walks from court with a good behaviour bond for endangering the life of a man he ran over with his car, while the victim says he continues to suffer nightmares.

title.children: Driver avoids jail for pinning, then running over man in Adelaide 'mayhem'

image.altText: A woman in chef's attire.

props.synopsis: Lawyers for Francesco Dimasi, who is accused of murdering his wife Maria Dimasi, have asked a court to order a specialist report into his fitness to stand trial.

title.children: Elderly man accused of wife's stabbing murder may not have viable defence, court hears

image.altText: An older Lebanese man wearing a white turban and beard stares intensely

props.synopsis: A new leader to replace Hassan Nasrallah as head of Hezbollah will be chosen "at the earliest opportunity", the group's deputy says.

title.children: Hezbollah deputy chief vows to fight ground invasion of Lebanon as new leader to be chosen imminently

image.altText: A woman wearing a black scarf reading Quran

props.synopsis: As more details emerge about the Israeli attack that killed Hezbollah's leader in Beirut, analysts say it's likely US-made 2,000 pound "bunker buster" bombs were used in the strikes carried out in the densely populated neighbourhood. Â

title.children: Israel used US-made 'bunker buster' bombs in attack on Hezbollah's leader, analysts say

image.altText: A yellow Hezbollah flag, featuring an arm reaching up to a rifle, seen above a sea of people.

props.synopsis: One of Victoria's peak Jewish community groups has described the appearance of Hezbollah flags at a Melbourne rally calling for ceasefires in Gaza and Lebanon as "highly alarming".

title.children: Police urged to lay charges after Hezbollah flag appears at Melbourne rally

image.altText: Treasure Boxes volunteers  2024-06-25 09:06:00

props.synopsis: Thousands of pregnant women in Australia are going hungry with many of those too scared to ask for help, according to new research.

title.children: One in ten expecting mothers are going hungry, survey finds

image.altText: three pages of legislation

props.synopsis: Current abortion legislation has been in effect for little more than two years, but a conservative MP argues it's time for more changes. And it comes despite concerns within his own party about his plan, Rory McClaren writes.

title.children: Abortion laws are once again being debated in SA, but some are wondering why

image.altText: A woman with short hair looks into camera with a serious expression.

props.synopsis: Retirement villages are home to more than 250,000 older Australians, but some residents complain of exorbitant fees, oppressive contracts and a sense of feeling trapped.

title.children: 'An absolute minefield': How these villages became a trap for retirees

image.altText: A court sketch of Terence Kelly at his sentencing for the kidnapping of four-year-old Cleo Smith in WA's outback.

props.synopsis: Terence Kelly fails to get his sentence reduced for abducting four-year-old Cleo Smith from her family's campsite in remote WA three years ago, with a judge rejecting his claim that his mental impairments should have been given greater weight.

title.children: Man who abducted four-year-old Cleo Smith from family tent fails in bid to reduce sentence

image.altText: Two men in suits smile and laugh, one is holding a model Rex Airlines plane.

props.synopsis: Rex Airlines's bosses are no longer on speaking terms, but they exclusively told Four Corners the inside story of their failed bid to take on Qantas and Virgin and just who's to blame.

title.children: For the first time since its collapse, Rex bosses share the inside story of how it all went wrong

image.altText: Liberal Troy Bell celebrates on election night

props.synopsis: Before a juror even set foot in the courtroom, the fraud trial of South Australian MP Troy Bell was one of the state's longest-running criminal prosecutions without a verdict. This is why it took so long.

title.children: Why it took almost a decade to prosecute a state MP

image.altText: An elderly man with grey trousers and blue shirt stands at the door of a red road train truck

props.synopsis: For 85 years, Howard Dicker has been in the driver's seat of the big rigs, connecting his bush community to the big smoke and beyond.

title.children: Pioneering trucker clocks up a lifetime of memories on the open road

image.altText: A boy wrapped in a blue blanket stands next to a destroyed building.

props.synopsis: Russia has launched several waves of drone attacks targeting Kyiv, according to Ukraine's military, with air defence units engaged in repelling the strikes for several hours.

title.children: Ukrainian military reports waves of Russian drone attacks on Kyiv

image.altText: Michael Theo wears a Hawaiian shirt as he leans half from behind a black curtain, an awkward look on his face

Michael Theo said he always felt like "a double scoop of dog crap". Now he's a leading man.

image.altText: A portrait of a woman with long blonde hair wearing a dress in a black room.

image.altText: Five people stand in a line with their arms around each other's shoulders, while a crowd gathers behind them.

title.children: Grocery prices compared between Australia, UK, NZ and Ireland â who comes out on top?

image.altText: A man walking while wearing a cap and glasses.

image.altText: A sign at the front gate of bed and breakfast accommodation

image.altText: Power station towers seen on a countryside landscape and cloudy sky.

title.children: UK becomes first G7 nation to end coal power with last plant closure

image.altText: Joe Daniher celebrates a grand final goal against Sydney

title.children: Brisbane won't want Joe Daniher to retire, but can still repeat as premiers if the grand final was his perfect farewell

image.altText: The rocks of Cape Schanck and the boardwalk is seen below a cloudy sky.

title.children: Woman drowns after being swept off rocks near Cape Schanck

image.altText: A woman with long brown hair plays with her two children, a boy and a girl with lighter hair, in a grassy yellow field.

props.synopsis: A program in Melbourne's south east that supports teenage mothers to reach their education and employment goals is having transformative results, but funding is set to run out.

title.children: This program is helping young mothers finish school and find work. Now it's run out of funding
